author: Dennis S
text:
According to the GSI, the fossils found in Tiruvakkarai are large trunks of plants drifted, deposited, and preserved in sedimentary rocks.— File Photo

Concerned over reports of fossils in the National Geological Monument at Tiruvakkarai in Villupuram district being damaged by miscreants, the Geological Survey of India is coordinating with the district administration to protect them.

“We have received inputs that suggest that the fossils in Tiruvakkarai are being damaged by some miscreants, who are trying to inscribe graffiti on them,” a senior official of the Geological Survey of India (GSI) said.

Since the fossils are not concentrated in an area and are found scattered in the location, the GSI had put up enclaves to protect them. “At nights, some miscreants come and attempt to break them,” he said.

Recently the GSI had put up a structure to prevent visitors from sitting on the ‘tree stone’ in Sathanur in Perambalur district. “On being alerted by the District Collector, we put up structures and now we will do the same in Tiruvakkarai too,” he said.
title: GSI to join hands with local officials to protect fossils
